snippet: People who repeatedly commit alcohol-related crimes will be forced to wear ankle tags that monitor their drinking, the mayor of London said.
abstract: London begins yearlong initiative that will force people who repeatedly commit alcohol-related crimes to wear ankle tags that monitor their drinking by recording levels of alcohol in their sweat every half-hour, aim is to relieve strains on the criminal justice system, police forces and health services.
lead_paragraph: People who repeatedly commit alcohol-related crimes will be forced to wear ankle tags that monitor their drinking, the mayor of London said.

headline.main: London Has Plans for Rowdy Drunks
headline.print_headline: London Has Plans for Rowdy Drunks
